title.narrative: Emergency assistance for improving livelihoods through skills training for returnees, internally displaced people and host communities in Herat, Afghanistan

description.narrative: The proposed project aims to contribute towards social stabilization in the Herat province by providing quick-impact entrepreneurship development and technical skills training to the IDPs, returnees and host communities, along with business support empowering them to create livelihood activities and small businesses. In the region, the agricultural value chain offers the best opportunity for entrepreneurial activities, with already existing production of food crops, husbandry and textile prevalent with a low market entry cost. In this regard, technical skills related to agribusiness and agro-processing will be promoted as per the needs of the target beneficiaries. Along with that to ensure sustainability, at the institutional level, the proposed project also intends to capacitate selected training centers in the region, through training of trainers(ToT) and through equipment transfer, that will ensure the continuation of entrepreneurship and skills training to the displaced people and host communities in the project area. This way, the proposed project aimed at assisting both IDPs, returnees and host communities will ensure the necessary emergency livelihood improvement support and will also contribute to medium- to long-term development in the region.
